Rather than distributing paper flyers, the district shares information about the community events, programs, and activities on this page.  Please check the page often for local events, children’s activities, summer camps, and more!

Organizations and district partners wishing to have event information here should e-mail Maura Manny, Director of Community Outreach and Communications, at m_manny@saratogaschools.org.

Events | Activities | Before and After School Care | Summer Camps and Enrichment

Events

NYS Special Needs and Disabilities Expo on September 21  The Expo will be held at the Albany Marriott from 10 a.m. to 4 p.m.  Click here to learn more about the expo.

Girl Scout Open House on September 29 at 6 p.m.  Join us for a fun-filled Girl Scout Night at Dorothy Nolan Elementary School where kids and parents can explore the exciting world of Girl Scouts together! Kids will enjoy hands-on crafts, games, or activities while parents learn all about the amazing adventures, friendships, and learning opportunities Girl Scouts offers. Girls in grades K-3 from any elementary school are invited to attend. Click here to learn more about the event.

Saratoga Book Festival:  Kate DiCamillo & Sophie Blackall: Lost Evangeline event on October 4, 2025    Join us for an interview & book signing with the author & illustrator on October 4, 2025  at Maple Avenue Middle School at 10:30 a.m.  Learn more about the event and how to buy tickets here:  https://friends.sspl.org/2025-authors/dicamillo/

Paint Collection Day on Saturday, October 4, 2025 Paint can be recycled and made into new paint. Bring your unwanted paint to the Saratoga Springs High School parking lot on October 4, 2025 from 9 a.m. to 1 p.m. Click here to learn more.

Before and After School Care

  • Saratoga YMCA BASE Program
  • Town of Wilton After School Program

Activities  

SPAC Arts Discovery After School Program  This program is open to all students in grades 2-5. Courses are scheduled to begin in September and are offered once a week on Tuesdays from 3:30 pm – 5:30 pm for 6 weeks. The tuition is $120 per student.  Register Online at: https://forms.gle/HMAazZbCYdoYYfA49Registrations are due: Friday, September 19.

STEAM Academy After School Program at Myers Education Center This program is open to all students in grades 3-6. Courses are scheduled to begin in October and are offered once a week on Thursdays from 3:45 pm – 5:15 pm for 5 weeks. The tuition for each course is $135 per student. Register Online at: https://forms.gle/mBXgo5V9GKKrK5wRA

Registrations are due: Friday, October 10th

Head Start – Now enrolling: Head Start is a free program for pregnant women and children through age 5 in Saratoga County. When a child is kindergarten eligible after attending Head Start, they have a better chance of succeeding, both by graduating high school and going to college or trade school. Head Start kids grow up to be anything they want to be! Complete an online application at lifeworksaction.org/head-start-programs 

BeTa Community Programs offer before & after-school enrichment programs as well as summer enrichment options. Learn more about BeTa at https://www.betacommunityprograms.com/.

Boy Scouts in Saratoga  Experience the thrill of scouting within the Saratoga Springs community with exciting activities for grades K-5. New packs accepting families. Contact Wendy Diefendorf at Wendy.Diefendorf@scouting.org.

Cub Scouts Boys and girls in grade K may join Cub Scouts. Contact Stephen Miller at smille18@nycap.rr.com.  Learn more at https://beascout.org/.

Nurtured in Nature at Pitney Meadows Community Farm  Nurtured in Nature meets weekly on Wednesdays for hour-long sessions at Pitney Meadows led by instructors Leah (Lanci) and Andrew Ferrone. Rooted in seasonal cycles and sensory exploration, the program alternates between nature-based science and nature-based mindfulness, allowing students to connect with the land while nurturing curiosity, creativity, critical thinking, and emotional well-being. Students will embark on an enriching journey, exploring the rhythm of nature through the distinct seasons of upstate New York in the living classroom of Pitney Meadows Community Farm.   Click here for more information.

Saratoga Rowing Association  Enjoy team sports and looking to try something new? Saratoga Rowing has Junior Competitive Programs for all athletes from 7th through 12th grade! Come experience a new team sport out on the water.  Email Program Director Mike MacMinn at mike.macminn@saratogarowing.com or click here for more information.

Youth All Recovery Support Group at The Prevention Council  The Youth All Recovery Support Group is an addiction support group for teens ages 14-17.  The group meets on Thursdays at 5:30 p.m. at the Prevention Council Recovery Center at 125 High Rock Ave. in Saratoga Springs.

Summer Camps & Enrichment

  • Camp Invention 
  • Camp Little Notch
  • Camp Saradac
  • NCTWC Girls Construction Camp
  • Innovation Saratoga 2025 Roller Coaster Camp
  • Saratoga Arts Summer Camp
  • Saratoga Kayak Shak
  • Saratoga Shredders Summer Camp
  • Saratoga Springs Recreation Camps
  • SUNY Adirondack Summer Enrichment
  • Town of Greenfield Summer Recreation Program
  • The Arts Center of the Capital Region Summer Classes
  • The Hyde Collection Summer Programs
  • Washington-Saratoga-Warren-Hamilton-Essex BOCES
  • YMCA Camp Toga
